long_description: The TextClassifier function classifies input text, using a model output by the function TextClassifierTrainer.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: The relation contains the text to be classified
input_tables.description: The relation contains the text to be classified

argument_clauses.name: TextColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the column of the input table that contains the text to be used for predicting classification.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the column of the input table that contains the text to use for predicting classification.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the names of the input columns to copy to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: Model
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the model (which you must install in the database before calling the function).
argument_clauses.description: Specify the model created by TextClassifierTrainer, which is installed on the ML Engine when it is created.

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
